mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Thomas Peter, 1799 September 7
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Carriage is sent as Mrs. Peter requested -- expects to see them about 3:00 -- Mrs. Washington has been very ill -- sent for Dr. Craik at midnight -- "Hers has been a kind of Ague and fever - the latter never entirely, intermitting until now. - I sent for the Doctor to her on Sunday last, but she could not, until he came the second time - yesterday morning - be prevailed upon to take anything to arrest them." On outside of cover George Washington has added that since sealing the letter her fever has returned -- please inform Mrs. [Eliza Parke Custis] Law. Autograph letter signed, 1 page, integral cover, directed "By Cyrus," laminated, watermark (George Washington's, incomplete).
